content: The National Oceanic and Atmospheric Administration (NOAA) reported that in some areas, the May 2015 deluge was “greater than a 1-in-1000 year event.” Extreme events are becoming much more common. As Craig Fugate, head of the U.S. Federal Emergency Management Agency (FEMA) under President Obama, said after the epic year of extreme weather in 2010, “The term ‘100-year event’ really lost its meaning this year.”
